On wheels, Tucson had a better chance of maneuvering between the blasts tha=
t Scorponok was throwing out.  He uses his current state to his advantage, =
and screches his rubber on his tires, pivoting them quickly to maneuver awa=
y from the blasts.  He had no sonar senses to guide him but he had his audo=
 sensors and his sense of feel and touch, guiding him.  The system that Rat=
 Trap was now holding merely augments his audio sensors and even though he =
could have used the device, he was now quickly getting used to not having i=
t on him.  And now, he could feel Rodimus's energy signature.  But first he=
 had to get rid of Scorponok and Dark Hawk.  He knew he did not have enough=
 energon in his main power core, but he did have a reserve stash in his bac=
kup battery.  He calculated that since he had hardly touched this backup, i=
t had close to ninety five percent capacity, yet it had to be used sparingl=
y.  This meant deciding between vehicle and robot mode.  He makes a quick a=
naylasis of his systems.. Which would be able to concerve more?  Vehicle or=
 robot mode?  

The truth was, they were equal in ussage.  But he knew he h=
ad to stick to vehicle mode, to make for a fast getaway if he did indeed fi=
nd a way out of there.. Meanwhile, hidden not too far now, from the torture=
 chamber, Rat Trap who has made his way into a vent hole, right over the ch=
amber, spots Tucson.  He then finds another bundle of wires and finds reada=
ble tags on them.

"It's wheels, he's up'n runn'n..  Must be on a backup ba=
ttery...  That might last a few hours but that's about it.  Okay, time for =
this rat ta be his rattiest!"  

He finds a tag that leads to the chamber, =
and begins to knaw at the wires that are connected to it.  He snaps them re=
adilly with his strong, buck teeth.  The doors suddenly open in the torture=
 chamber.

"WHEELS, BURN RUBBER!"

Tucson could hear Rat Trap's voice and w=
ithout questioning him, he spins his rear tires, creates a smoke screen and=
 senses the wind coming in from the open doors.  He takes this opportunity =
to get past Scorponok, via creating a low lying smoke cloud, cloaking his c=
hassse, and manges to get outside the chamber, stopping in front of Rodimus=
.  Rat Trap continues to knaw at wires, hoping that one of them was another=
 wire that would disable the security and weaponry systems.

Outside, Tucso=
n transforms into robot mode and in front of Rodimus.  This was it,he was f=
ace to face with his former leader.  Rat Trap positions himself inside, at =
a peek hole, to watch what's happening.

"Lord Elder, you wont' believe thi=
s, but, Tucson got outa there, and he's face ta face with Rodimus.  I sure =
hope he gives 'em his come uppn's.  Lousey worthless piece of Scrap..  I ho=
pe wheels drives you to the ground'n then some... "

At the Ark and shuttle=
 area...

Quickstride looks around and focuses on the shuttle.  Yet, the bo=
dy of Optimus Prime holds his attention for a moment as he looks up to him.=


"Wow, you must've been one heck of a leader in your days.  Rat Trap says =
he's with someone who's related to you.  I wish I could do something ta hel=
p you guys get back on your wheels, but I'm just a Maximal and I really don=
't know how to bring your men back ta life...  That Autobot out there could=
 sure use your help, looks like that Rodimus guy really let you down and ga=
ve into those Predacons. I really can't judge the guy because I wasn't ther=
e when it happened, but from what Rat Trap says, I - dunno if I could ever =
respect a leader who weakens under pressure.  Okay, I gotta go, Lord Elder =
needs my help.  Rest in peace.

He salutes the still form of Optimus Prime =
and gets to the shuttle. 

"Lord Elder, I've reached the shuttle and I'm no=
w performing preliminary take off proceedures."

> that gave him the chills, e=
specially when he didn't need to go in
> there.

in the shadows, listening the words of the
> others like Darkhawk, Scorpono=
k and that Autobot Tuscon. there was
> something about that Autobot that se=
emed to grate on his nerves. He
> wasn't sure what it was, maybe it was his=
 high sounding talk, maybe it
> was his tenacity, maybe it was his . . . .
=
> 
> *SLAM!*
> 
> Rodimus was jolted out of his revelry by the doors slammi=
ng shut,
> cutting him off from the torture chamber. Inside he could hear
>=
 threatening tones coming from Scorponok and Darkhawk, and the sound of
> a=
 vehicle's engine revving.
> 
> Rodimus' attention was diverted from furthe=
r listening as a message
> came over his comms, a text message from Percept=
or.

> > "Rodimus... Go to this sector and watch out that our enemies doe=
snt go inside" typed Perceptor fast and send the secret message "They mustn=
t get her... Do what ever you have to to stop them"
> 
> "Yes!" Rodimus jum=
ped as he could see the urgency with the speed that
> Perceptor was typing =
the message. "On my way!" he sent back as he
> received the location from P=
erceptor.
> 
> Rodimus was surprised, as the location was only a short dist=
ance away.
> With a thought he quickly shifted into his vehicle, gunned his=
 motor
> and moved swiftly. He figured the 'her' that Perceptor was referri=
ng
> to was Nightlight. Nightlight was Rodimus' wife, he would not let
> th=
ose idiot Maximals get their hands on her!
